channel.title: Sodium Flouride
channel.description:
Why the fuck do they put it in our water?
Yes it whitens are teeth, but couldn't we use something else? Sodium Fluoride is fucking poision. It makes our bones brittle, lowers IQ, and makes us vulnerable to arthritis.
So why would they risk all of that, just to make our teeth a bit whiter?
Illuminati.

item.title: Sodium Flouride
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Javafire, post:64, topic:381950”]poison is poison, liberals want to brainwash you and rule the world. end of discussion.[/quote]You are really retarded aren’t you.

For everyone who still thinks the sodium flouride in the water will kill you…

Verywell Health

The Controversial Link Between Fluoride and Thyroid Disease

FFluoride and the Thyroid: The Controversy - a look at the controversy over fluoride and fluoridation of water, and the health effects on the thyroid.

That talks about the sodium flouride in water, toothpaste, and rat posion. Just so you can clear everything up.

Read full topic

item.title: Sodium Flouride
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:59, topic:381950”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=477756.msg3499233#msg3499233 date=1297608403]

government wants you dead. that’s the reason for sodium fluoride, and the words eco-friendly.
[/quote]No… I’m guessing its a poison to biological life, but you have to have a fair amount of it in relation to your mass for it to do harm. The smaller singular celled organisms and bacteria that propagate inside of your mouth are small enough to be killed by the NaFl. It won’t do you any harm compared to what is already in water. You cannot find H20 very easily, H20 does not conduct electricity but water you drink does because of the vast amount of impurities in it. Humans can tolerate this as they’ve built an immunity to it. If you’re going to worry about NaCl then you should worry about everything else in water and not drink at all.

NaFl is poison!

I didn’t specify otherwise, quote “I’m guessing its a poison to biological life”.

I know
It’s still poison

So is water, because if you drink to much, you die from water poisoning.

So what was your point again?

That it is poison :
But… how do you drink too much water though? Shouldn’t your body automatically throw it up or something?[/quote]
You could say the same about alcohol…

Read full topic

You cannot find H20 very easily, H20 does not conduct electricity but water you drink does because of the vast amount of impurities in it. Humans can tolerate this as they’ve built an immunity to it. I’m assuming my town doesn’t do this. As far as I know it’s just chlorine treated. Sodium flouride makes me lose my hair, so I should look >.>

item.title: Sodium Flouride
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:37, topic:381950”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=477756.msg3496356#msg3496356 date=1297354774]
Maybe there is something everyone here doesn’t get about IT HAS TO BE A HIGH AMOUNT AND IT IS MEASURED…
[/quote]
What if someone drinks too much water?[/quote]

It’s deadly to drink too much pure water as well.

edit: looks like someone already beat me to that:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:43, topic:381950”]Shit guys, drinking too much pure water is also fatal!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_intoxication[/quote]

Also, it’s not to ‘whiten your teeth’ it’s to strengthen your teeth, to prevent cavities and such.

Only some cities put this in the water though, not all of them. And then a lot of people like me have well water, so we get fresh, clean water from the ground instead of the processed stuff you guys get.

Read full topic

item.title: Sodium Flouride
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Shit guys, drinking too much pure water is also fatal!

en.wikipedia.org

Water intoxication

Water intoxication, also known as water poisoning, hyperhydration, or water toxemia is a potentially fatal disturbance in brain functions that results when the normal balance of electrolytes in the body is pushed outside safe limits by overhydration (excessive water intake). Under normal circumstances, accidentally consuming too much water is exceptionally rare. Nearly all deaths related to water intoxication in normal individuals have resulted either from water-drinking contests, in which indivi...

Read full topic
